column4: Last time I installed AMD64 Ubuntu it had a few problems, like packages I wanted were only available in x86 repositories, and I couldn't get some of my more proprietary hardware to work.  Can anybody tell me if the situation has improved in the past 1.5 year or so?
I'm trying to decide if I should install AMD64 or just x86
The things that didn't work last time were Wine, the binary nvidia drivers, and ndiswrapper on my Broadcom wireless
wine won't run 64bit - only way is a 32bit chroot
